title: Court puts reinstatement of cannabis commission head on hold
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Judge ordered reinstatement of Cannabis Control Commission Chair Shannon O'Brien, but appeal delays her return.
State Treasurer Goldberg fired O'Brien in 2024, claiming gross misconduct and race-based remarks.
O'Brien's reinstatement and back pay are on hold pending the state's appeal in the Massachusetts Appeals Court.

title: Man charged with murder after woman, 38, found dead in Lynn, DA says
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: A 38-year-old woman was found dead on Newhall Street in Lynn early Sunday morning.
A 30-year-old Lynn man was arrested and charged with murder following the woman's death.
The suspect is scheduled to be arraigned in Lynn District Court on Monday.

title: Jakobi Meyers shuts down questions about trade request: ‘Happy to be a Raider’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jakobi Meyers confirms he's happy with the Raiders despite requesting a trade over contract negotiations.
Meyers recorded eight catches for 97 yards against the Patriots in his Gillette Stadium return.
The Raiders, now led by coach Pete Carroll and QB Geno Smith, won 20-13 in Foxborough.

title: Tornado confirmed in Mass. town as powerful storm sweeps over region
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: The National Weather Service confirmed a tornado touchdown in Holden, Massachusetts during Saturday's storm.
A severe thunderstorm watch was issued from Baltimore to northern Maine, including nearly all of Massachusetts.
Communities like Paxton and Holyoke dealt with fallen electrical lines and trees, causing power outages and damage.

title: In a season promising change, the 2025 Patriots looked all too familiar in season opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The New England Patriots opened their 2025 season with a 20-13 loss to the Las Vegas Raiders.
Quarterback Drake Maye struggled in the second half, completing only seven passes for 51 yards post-interception.
Free-agent Harold Landry III stood out on defense with 2.5 sacks, but explosive plays from Raiders led to their victory.

title: Will Campbell’s NFL debut was solid until things began to unravel late in the second half
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Rookie left-tackle Will Campbell struggled in the second half, allowing two sacks and committing two false start penalties.
Patriots' head coach Mike Vrabel offered a cautious assessment of Campbell's performance, citing both good and bad plays.
Despite late-game issues, Raiders' Maxx Crosby praised Campbell's potential and future under Coach Josh McDaniels.

title: Lynn police officer on leave after becoming ‘suddenly incapacitated’ while on duty
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A Lynn police officer is on leave after becoming 'suddenly incapacitated' during a traffic stop, indicating a medical episode.
Video shows the officer unresponsive and struggling to stand, sparking accusations of drug or alcohol influence by a bystander.
Lynn Police are investigating, analyzing body-camera footage and consulting medical professionals; administrative leave is standard policy.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled against the Raiders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots lost their home opener 20-13 to the Raiders, starting the Mike Vrabel era with a loss at Gillette Stadium.
Harold Landry III excelled with 2.5 sacks and several key defensive plays, marking a strong debut for the linebacker.
The running game struggled as the Patriots rushed for only 60 yards, with Rhamondre Stevenson averaging 2.1 yards per carry.

title: Review & setlist: Dropkick Murphys come on strong, avert disaster at soggy Suffolk Downs
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: Dropkick Murphys performed at Seisiún festival at Suffolk Downs on September 6, 2025, despite a significant rain delay.
The concert resumed two hours after a thunderstorm, and attendees re-entered to see performances by Dropkick Murphys and The Hold Steady.
The band played a mix of songs, involving the audience and tributing Shane McGowan, concluding with 'I'm Shipping Up To Boston.'

title: Bill Belichick explains ‘simple’ reason why he decided to ban Patriots scout at UNC
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bill Belichick banned a Patriots scout from UNC practices, citing unwelcomeness at each other's facilities.
Belichick's relationship with the Patriots has been strained since leaving the team after the 2023 season.
Patriots head coach Mike Vrabel acknowledged UNC's decision and plans alternate ways to gather player information.
